attributes.action: UK RIOTS- CALL TO THE GOVERNMENT TO REINSTATE  FUNDING FOR LONDON YOUTH CENTRES
attributes.additional_details:
Government cuts on youth services have shown to represent a threat to our society following the recent events nationwide - the UK Riots.

Hundreds of thousands of young people throughout the UK are affected by the closure of youth clubs which have certainly contributed to the UK Rioting chaos we are recently faced with.

Riots started in Tottenham, an area which is part of the north London borough of Haringey whose youth clubs were shut after the youth services budget was slashed by 75%, a cut of £41m to the council's overall budget.

We are asking our government to reinstate funding to Youth Services in London, cuts need to be reconsidered and our youth needs to be cared for and not simply left on the streets, especially during times where unemployment figures are so high.
